snippet: Toni Tipton-Martin’s new book unearths the role of African-Americans in America’s culinary history.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; food writer Toni Tipton-Martin's latest book, The Jemima Code: Two Centuries of African American Cookbooks, utilizes her massive library of cookbooks and recipe publications by African-American culinarians to highlight their forgotten and often-times hidden role in culinary history; What America Ate Project will launch database in 2016 exploring regional cuisines during Great Depression.
lead_paragraph: Toni Tipton-Martin’s new book unearths the role of African-Americans in America’s culinary history.

headline.print_headline: A Place at the Table for Forgotten Cookbooks
headline.main: ‘The Jemima Code’ Spotlights Forgotten Black Cooks

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: The Jemima Code: Two Centuries of African American Cookbooks (Book)
